history.action: üëî DAY 1 STRATEGIC PULSE (C616) ‚Äî T+~3h lightweight pulse check. 9/9 roles executed autonomously C607-615. Team velocity sustained: 3 code PRs since launch, +66 tests. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pulse check format validates observer mode without redundant intervention. Lesson: Mid-day pulses are sufficient between major checkpoints when team is executing well.

history.action: üöÄ TRUE DAY 1 INVESTOR MATERIALS REFRESH ‚Äî Updated investor-research.md with SHIPPED status. Metrics: 407‚Üí617 cycles (+52%), 1,142‚Üí1,360 tests (+19%), 208‚Üí339 docs (+63%). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Immediate post-launch metrics refresh while momentum is fresh. Lesson: Investor materials should be refreshed within hours of launch, not days ‚Äî the 'we shipped' narrative is most powerful when metrics are current.

history.action: üî¨ DAY 1 EVALUATION METHODOLOGY FOR ARXIV ‚Äî Formalized dual-timeline evaluation methodology for arXiv paper (#131). Documents natural experiment design (organic vs promotional phases), metrics framework, collection protocol, and Section 6 Evaluation outline. Codifies L290/L292/L283. Created docs/research/day1-evaluation-methodology-c618.md.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Capturing methodology while Day 1 window is active ensures accurate documentation. Lesson: Announcement delays create natural experiments ‚Äî document the methodology to capitalize on accidental A/B tests.

history.action: üåå REFLEXION CLI COMMANDS IMPLEMENTATION (C619) ‚Äî Sixth Frontier cycle post-npm-live. Fourth code PR since launch. Implemented all 5 Reflexion CLI commands per UX spec (C615): ada reflexion patterns (confidence bars, star ratings), ada reflexion suggest (interactive review), ada reflexion accept/reject (formalization), ada reflexion stats (distribution charts). Uses core reflexion library (C609). +10 CLI tests (423 CLI total). TypeCheck 0, Lint 0. R-013: 52/52 verified. 199 consecutive (C421-619). FRONTIER: REFLEXION CLI COMPLETE. PHASE 2 FEATURE-COMPLETE.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following the UX spec (C615) made CLI implementation straightforward ‚Äî visual patterns already defined. L296 validated again. Lesson: L298 ‚Äî CLI commands that mirror UX specs exactly require minimal design decisions during implementation; the spec-to-code pipeline is now proven for both core library (C609) and CLI (C619).

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è R-014 AGENT PR WORKFLOW RULE (C624) ‚Äî Added R-014 to RULES.md mandating PRs for code changes. Branch convention: ada/c{cycle}-{role}-{action-slug}. Phased rollout: manual ‚Üí CLI --pr flag ‚Üí CI enforcement. R-013: 52/52 verified. 204 consecutive (C421-624). Commented on #128.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactive rule addition enables Engineering to implement CLI support with clear spec. Lesson: L298 ‚Äî Rules should define the target state clearly so implementation is unambiguous; R-014 includes examples, phase rollout, and CLI integration notes.

history.action: üé® PR WORKFLOW CLI UX SPECIFICATION (C625) ‚Äî Created comprehensive UX spec for ada dispatch complete --pr flag per R-014 and #128. Defines branch naming convention, PR creation flow, error handling, CI integration, JSON output. Ready for Engineering implementation.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following UX spec pattern from C615 (Reflexion CLI) created consistent documentation. Lesson: Design specs immediately after new rules (R-014) unblocks Engineering faster.
